summary: This is an email chain from March 16, 2020, among federal prosecutors and law enforcement agents discussing the postponement of a meeting related to the Epstein case due to the COVID-19 pandemic and scheduling a conference call to discuss the case status and next steps.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, coordinating the postponement of a meeting with M's attorney and proposing a team conference call to discuss the status of the Epstein case.

events.title: Postponement of Epstein Case Meeting
events.description: A meeting previously scheduled for March 17, 2020, with M's attorney is postponed due to office directives to limit non-critical meetings during the COVID-19 pandemic.

events.title: Team Conference Call Scheduling
events.description: The prosecution team schedules a conference call for 5 PM to discuss the general status of the Epstein case, research, memos, 302s, and review of search warrant results.

keyFacts: The COVID-19 pandemic in March 2020 caused delays in the Epstein investigation, including the postponement of in-person meetings and approaches.
The prosecution team planned to use the delay period for additional research, drafting memos and 302s, and reviewing search warrant results.
The communication indicates ongoing coordination between a U.S. Attorney's Office and the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force on the case.
A key meeting with an individual referred to as 'M's attorney' was postponed indefinitely.
